column4: I'm not sure if Gnome can do this by default, but I heard someone wrote a program that enables you to do this. Check Osnews' archives for a recent article about Gnome and it should be on the forums (sorry couldnt be of more help)
Thanks I'll go check
The project i mentioned above is hosted somewhere on sourceforge
Kewl thanks ... I think Riddell is right and I did this in KDE a loooong time ago (switched to gnome ~ 4 years ago!!) but now I can do this anyhow :)
no prob...ill try to remember the exact name...but it was a couple of weeks ago
Found it on gnomefiles http://www.gnomefiles.org/app.php?soft_id=270
Actually I just upgraded to hoary a short while ago and it works great!! :)
alright, thx, i might try it out in a bit. someone on osnews was complaining about hoary breaking their system but no one else was complaining so i held off

The friend who got me hooked on Ubuntu (last sunday) told me to upgrade while it was fresh as the first time he upgraded he had a couple issues ... second time was the charm for him ... first try for me worked great :)
maybe you need the dev packages?? try checking synaptic
I guess I need to learn what to apt-get as I just tried to sudo apt-get install gtk ... forgot I'd need the dev for this :)
i once needed libsndfile a ./configure script told me, so i checked yum (was on fedora at this point) and it was installed, took me hours to figure out i needed libsndfile-dev ;)

Not a big fedora fan ... tried it for 2 weeks and couldn't play smac (I'm in a pbem group on linuxgamers.com) so I tried Ubuntu ... after less than a week I don't think I'm ever switching to anything else!!
yeah, i found it was buggy and unstable...ubuntu is much much better
not sure....whats the name of the program again?? ill see if i can google something up for you
try searching synaptic, maybe the name is a tad different or something....i have found entering a couple letters from a name i am looking for sometimes helps me find it
lol, never mind
lol, i know....is the program still maintained? maybe it isnt maintained anymore so it isnt included in the normal repos?
You mean this little app?  I doubt it ever made any release beyond source
hopefully it works....i honestly have never tried it
lol, post me a link
im surprised the gnome people dont take over the project....it is a feature a lot of people ask for....if i knew how to code.....:P
